summary: The Tunisia Democracy Restoration Act aims to support democracy in Tunisia and counter the regime of Kais Saied. The bill mandates sanctions against foreign persons involved in undermining democratic processes, corruption, or human rights abuses in Tunisia. It requires a list of sanctioned individuals and outlines property blocking and visa restrictions. The President can waive sanctions under specific conditions. Additionally, the Secretary of State must submit a strategy to Congress on restoring democracy in Tunisia. The act has a sunset clause, ceasing to be effective after four years.
